message.content:
Step 1: Calculate FCF  
• FCF is computed by summing the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities and the Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities.  
• From the cash flow statement, the values for 2024-02-01 are:  
 – Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -2,419,019.09  
 – Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities = -0.00  
• Hence, FCF = -2,419,019.09 + (-0.00) = -2,419,019.09  

Step 2: Calculate Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
• The Current Assets Turnover Ratio = (Revenue) / (Average Current Assets)  
• Revenue for this period (from the income statement) is given as 863,371.65.  
• Average Current Assets = (Beginning Current Assets + Ending Current Assets) / 2  
 – Beginning Current Assets = 8,000,000.00 (from the balance sheet dated 2023-12-31)  
 – Ending Current Assets = 13,753,616.13 (from the balance sheet dated 2024-02-01)  
• Average Current Assets = (8,000,000.00 + 13,753,616.13) / 2 = 21,753,616.13 / 2 = 10,876,808.065  
• Current Assets Turnover Ratio = 863,371.65 / 10,876,808.065 ≈ 0.07936, which rounded is approximately 0.08  

Thus, the solution in the required JSON format is:  

{
  "solution": {
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-2419019.09",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.08"
  }
}
